Warning! Unfortunately, no working saving method has been found in your browser. You can still play, but any saves will be lost when you leave the game.

This is normally caused by disabling cookies or third-party cookies. This game uses a method similar to cookies to save your cities. Third-party cookies may be required as the game is often running on another domain than the web gaming portal.

Please try enabling cookies. Then, reload the page. Otherwise, you can still Export your cities from the Game Menu and Import them again later.

As you probably know, our climate is changing because of greenhouse gas emissions caused by humans. We only have about a decade left to drastically reduce emissions if we want to prevent the worst effects, which could include flooding, droughts and major health risks. Here are just a few actions you can take:
It is very important that governments create laws that help companies and people reduce greenhouse gas emissions. Therefore, please vote for a sensible party whenever you can.
There are amazing meat alternatives, that taste great and cause far less harmful emissions. Also, beans or nuts can be a good alternative source of protein.
Flying causes a huge amount of CO2 emission. Stay on the ground whenever you can. If you like to travel, taking the train is a great, fun option!
Knowledge is power! Read climate news and facts on sites like The Guardian Environment and the Climate Reality Project.

Pathfinding threads are used to compute movement paths for citizens. If all pathfinding threads are busy, citizens may stand still and wait until one is available. Increasing this will improve the simulation in large cities. The recommended value is the number of physical cores of your processor minus one. Higher values may have a negative impact on the frame rate.\nIf you don't know what this all means, I completely understand! Just keep this at the default.
Click to reset the pathfinding thread limit to the default.

Your citizens will certainly appreciate a roof above their heads.
Five people can live in this strange home full of otherworldly technology.
This rustic-looking house makes people think of Earth. The housing quality is increased by 15 if there are at least three other modern rustic homes or parks next to it.
It's not exactly luxurious, but still quite comfortable.
The mechanics and heating of this house need a Machine Parts Factory to function. The housing quality is increased by 50 if there is one next to it.
Build at least three Machine Parts Factories to unlock!
A modern house with lots of space.
A hypermodern home filled with technology.
Build the Living Research Center to unlock!
A home in the middle of a park.
This house is designed for makers and inventors. Residents earn extra education.
This house gives a strong sense of community. Produces a small amount of food, wood or stone for each resident. Most upgrades don't apply to this production.
Residents of this hut will really flourish!
Build ten blossom restaurants to unlock!
Residents automatically gain healthcare and some education.
A luxurious, modern villa complete with a private teleporter.
A lavish rooftop house. It makes residents live longer. It also comes with a private teleporter.
The landing pad works like a bus stop in space. People can take a space ship from here to other landing pads. Can only be placed on the ground or on a rooftop.
Living in this exploration ship may not be very comfortable, but it's certainly very adventurous! Can only be placed on the ground or on a rooftop.
Allows citizens to quickly go to elevators above and below in the same contiguous building. There may be other buildings in between the elevators.
Have at least 200 citizens to unlock!
Allows citizens to travel horizontally to other train stations. There may be other buildings in between them. Each train station comes with one train.
The very fastest form of transportation. Allows citizens to instantly go to other teleporters.
Woodcutters retrieve their materials here, then go to the nearest forest to cut wood.
Stone miners retrieve their materials here, then go to the nearest rock to mine stone.
Crops can be grown here to produce food.
Explore alien ruins to gain knowledge, resources and special bonuses. When all ruins have been explored, workers will investigate their findings to gain more knowledge.
Produces machine parts from stone. Three stone is needed to make one machine part.
Scientists gather knowledge here. Also has upgrades boosting adjacent farms and tree plantations.
These trees are kept in an optimal environment and regrow faster than trees on the world surface. Woodcutters from a Woodcutting Center can help cut them down.
Teleports meteoroids to your city. Doesn't produce stone by itself; miners from Stone Mines can gather stone from the meteroids.
Produces refined metals from stone. Five stone is needed to make one unit of refined metal.
Produces computer chips from refined metals. Seven units of refined metals are needed to make one computer chip.!unlocks
Produces food sustainably. Also generates a small amount of nature entertainment happiness.
Build an Experimental Farm and ten Botanical Gardens to unlock!
Produces wood for each adjacent farm. Each farm only produces enough by-products for one By-Product Processor.

Scientists experiment with machine parts here. You earn five knowledge for every machine part used. This knowledge production is faster than with normal labs.\nRefined Metal Factories above and below this building work faster and use 10% less stone per unit of refined metal.
Build twelve mechanical houses, ten refined metal factories and three computer chip factories to unlock!
This lab researches the production and applications of graphene. Workers gather knowledge. They also slowly produce graphene for two stone per sheet.
This factory makes graphene. To make one sheet of graphene, 10 knowledge and one stone is used. If the building is placed to the right of a rock teleporter, no stone is used.
Cacao is grown here. It can be used directly as food or to make chocolate.
(this building has been scrapped earlier in development)
This factory uses cacao to make chocolate.
(this building has been scrapped earlier in development)
Educates children, improving how effective they'll be at some jobs later.
Improves the education of visitors of all ages.
Herbs and spices are grown here. They make food taste better, reducing the amount of food people need. Also has an extra effect depending on the herb type.
Helps people live longer and better.
Build a Refined Metals Factory to unlock!
A great place for people to get together.
A cozy place with nice food.
Build at least five Pubs to unlock!
A charming little pub that doubles up as a refined metals factory.\nIt can't be boosted by Experimentation Labs, though.
Dine under the beautiful tree blossom! If you build multiple restaurants on top of each other, people can sit on tree branches.
A nice garden full of exotic plants.
Build at least ten Parks and five Labs to unlock!
Makes your city a bit more fishy and provides nature entertainment.
Build at least twelve herb gardens to unlock!
Some people will have a lot of fun in this nightclub.
A nightclub full of strange luminous machines.
Build a Refined Metals Factory to unlock!
People love to play board games together.
(this building has been scrapped earlier in development)
Fun games for the whole family.
Build a Computer Chip Factory to unlock!
Makes all machine parts factories in your city work faster. Also, workers can gather knowledge or produce machine parts from wood.
A researcher can gather knowledge from this little spacecraft. There can be no building or world directly above this.
Food is produced here. Also slightly increases the growth speed of crops in indoor farms.
Produces knowledge. Can only be placed on the ground or on a rooftop.
A house full of creativity. Generates art entertainment happiness.
Build at least three Modern Art Museums to unlock!
Allows you to implement city policies and to change the name of your city.
Boosts stone production based on your knowledge production and the number of workers.
Build at least 15 Stone Mines and three Rock Teleporters to unlock!
Produces knowledge and allows you to research and build Computer Chip Factories.
Build at least five Labs and a Refined Metal Factory to unlock!
Upgrades for homes can be researched here. Also houses two people and produces knowledge.
Have at least 200 citizens with homes to unlock!
These hardware hackers are actually really nice and helpful.\nThey spend most of their days tinkering around with computers and electronics. Some of their inventions are more useful than others.
Build at least three Arcades to unlock!
A specialized computer built to decrypt alien secrets.
A challenging lab-themed escape room, which generates gaming entertainment happiness. It also has lasers!

Whenever someone uses a teleporter, there is a small chance they will be brought here instead. This will confuse them for a short while. This invention is not completely useless though: you will gain some knowledge each time. Also, the Misdirector halves the operating cost of teleporters.
The Secret Society of the Key requests a place of residence. It can then give you tasks that you would be honored to complete.
Makes Secret Society of the Key members live forever. Also produces random resources every day.
These hippies love flowers, peace and music. They have a few tasks for you, if you don't mind.
Build a stack of Botanical Gardens at least twenty buildings high to unlock!
Organize awesome festivals to entertain your citizens!
Produces knowledge based on the amount of lab employees in your city. Also allows you to research some city upgrades.
Fossils found by the Fossil Detector are displayed here. Improves the education of visitors. Workers produce knowledge based on the number of fossils you found.
Your citizens' reward for reaching 100 happiness!
The birthday gift of a Secret Society of the Key member who reached the respectable age of 500!
Your citizens' reward for keeping them really happy for a while!
Maintain :D or better happiness for at least fourteen days to unlock!
Flowers improve the happiness of residents. Improves housing quality by 5.
Two stone is now used to make a machine part instead of three.
The factory will fully halt production.
The factory will fully halt production and not use any stone.
The factory will fully halt production and not use any refined metals.
The factory will work twice as fast, but also use two more stone per machine part.
The factory will work 50% faster, but also use one more stone per unit of refined metal produced.
The lab will not use any machine parts nor produce knowledge. It can still boost Refined Metal Factories.
The lab will not use any machine parts, but its knowledge output is halved. It can still boost Refined Metal Factories.
Crops of adjacent farms produce 7 more food per harvest.
Trees in adjacent tree plantations grow 20% faster.
Use better pickaxes to improve mining speed by 20%.
Use a computer system to improve mining speed by 30%.
The factory will work 50% faster and use two less units of refined metals per computer chip.
The entertainment capacity of the building will be doubled.
The quality of this building will be increased by 25% of the education happiness.
The quality of this building will be increased by 25 and its capacity will be doubled.
The worker of the rock teleporter can teleport stone even if they're somewhere else. This allows them to help mine stone as well.
Improves housing quality by 5. Adds capacity for one resident.
A plant that's been cultivated to be extremely good at cleaning the air. Improves housing quality by 10 and makes residents live longer.
This building produces 50% more knowledge. If the Precise Universe Mapping upgrade from the Supercomputer has been researched, it produces 500% more knowledge instead.
Any attempt at teleportation will bring people here. Perfect to stop excess productivity.\nThe knowledge gain per misdirection is reduced by 90% because the device is overloaded.
There's an OFF button. It mostly works.
With some effort, the Misdirector can be tamed.
The boost to stone production is increased and scales faster with knowledge production.
Whenever a rock teleporter teleports a meteoroid, there is a tiny chance that a fossil is detected in it. When this happens, you gain 10000 knowledge.
You gain two more knowledge for each machine part used.
The passive growth speed of these trees is tripled.
Increases the capacity of restaurants to the left and right of the garden.
Improves the medical happiness. Herb gardens can't provide more than 20% of the medical happiness in total.
Plant young trees which will grow to a forest.
Plant young trees which will grow to a pine forest.
Place a rock on a world for decoration. It can be mined, unless you protect it.
Place a boulder on a world for decoration. It can be mined, unless you protect it.
Build houses for your citizens to live in.
Build production buildings to get more resources.
Services help people, improving their lives.
Build entertainment to keep your citizens happy.
Build transportation to let citizens move on and between worlds quickly.
Only one of each of these special buildings can be built.
Place decoration on the ground, and plant forests.
Improves the house quality of all Wooden Houses by 10.
Improves the house quality of all Spacious Houses by 15.
Improves the house quality of all Alien Houses by 25. Also unlocks a building upgrade for them.
Improves the house quality of the Secret Society of the Key by 25.
Adds capacity for one more resident in all Mechanical Houses and Tinkerers' Houses.
Adds capacity for one more resident in all Spacious Houses.
Allows you to decrease or increase the population growth.
When you destroy a building, you get back half its cost.
When you destroy a building, you get back 75% of its cost (currently 50%).
When you destroy a building, you get back 90% of its cost (currently 75%).
Clear any decoration from a world surface.
Earth is a wasteland. You built a space ship, but now food is running out. A tiny world is your only hope.
When a world turns out to be way too small, you decide to build a city that crosses worlds.
Use computers to modernize a city.
You discover some alien influences on your newest outpost.
Build the city of your dreams on this huge world!
Construct a complex city on this random clique of worlds.
A huge, barren world that you can furnish to your desire, plus some small worlds filled with resources.
Mind the gap! It separates forests and rocks.
Countless tiny worlds, randomly placed in space.
Many tiny mini worlds, plus a huge mostly empty one!
Construct a complex city on this clique of worlds.
Welcome to this Free Play Scenario!\nA few citizens are already here. Some more will arrive over the coming days.
All the people from your ship have now arrived. Of course, your population can still grow through their offspring.
It's 2142, and earth is a wasteland. Colonizing this tiny world is humanity's only hope.\n\nFirst, you'll need some more building materials. Let's build a woodcutting center.
Good job! Now, collect some wood and build a stone mine.
Well done! Right now, nobody is going to gather stone, as everybody already has a job at the woodcutting center. Let's reassign one of these workers.
Gather 6 wood and 4 stone. You'll need to reassign some workers.

You used a space ship to get here. Some of your friends are still on it. You'll want to give them a place to live. A steady food supply would be nice, too.\n\nTo accomplish these goals, let's build a house and an indoor farm.[nonmobi] Please note that buildings can be stacked.
Build a house and an indoor farm.

Good job! Some more people will arrive soon.\nIt could be helpful to learn some more about this world. In particular, the alien ruins look quite interesting. Let's build an exploration center to learn all about them and maybe get some useful resources too.

New people will now start arriving regularly. Make sure to keep them fed and housed. Also, children can be born from now on. You can build a school for them if you want.[n]\nTo build up your city, you'll need lots of stone, so let's build one more stone mine.

[c]Your stone miners have good equipment thanks to the Better Pickaxes upgrade. Great job![/][n]Your stone miners are currently working with low-quality mining equipment. Better pickaxes would improve their mining speed. Upgrade at least one of your stone mines. To do so, [nonmobi]click[mobi]tap[/] on the stone mine, then on the Better Pickaxes upgrade.
Upgrade a stone mine with better pickaxes.

Now that you've got a pretty good economy, it's time to focus on your citizens' wellbeing for a bit. Not that there's no economic advantage to that at all, as happy citizens work faster. To make them more happy, let's build a pub. Also, make sure you have at least 10 food.
Build a pub and have at least 10 food.

Great job! Make sure there's actually someone working at the pub or it won't have any effect.\nThe city will need machines. [c]Fortunately, you looked ahead and have already built a machine parts factory.[/c][n]Let's build a machine parts factory to be able to construct them.[/n]

The machine parts factory uses lots of stone, so make sure you have enough! If you need stone for something else, just switch it off for a while.[n]\nIt's always nice to see happy faces, isn't it? Let's make sure the happiness in your city is at least 52. Just [nnonmobi]click[nmobi]tap[n] on the Happiness button if you'd like to see which areas could use improvement.[/n]
Bring the happiness in your city above 52.

The amount of stone on this planet is quite limited. Fortunately, you've just thought of a way to solve that problem: a rock teleporter could teleport mineable rocks from elsewhere. Let's research and build one. You may want to build some labs to get more knowledge.

Well done! You'll never run out of stone now. Keep your stone mines, as you need those workers to mine the meteroids.\nYour population is growing quickly, and this world is quite small. It's probably a good idea to look for other worlds to colonize, so let's build an observatory.

Great job! Your scientists will now look for other worlds to colonize. You can play the next scenario to see what they'll find.\nIf you'd like to continue improving this city, you can always go to the next scenario later from the menu. Either way, you can always return to this city later.

Soon after building the observatory, your scientists found a world that looked promising. You decided to fly there and take a look. Apparently, your scientists didn't look very closely, because what they thought to be one world are actually multiple tiny worlds. Still, this looks like a fairly suitable location to build a city.\nTo get started, let's build a woodcutting center, a stone mine, an indoor farm and a house.
Build a woodcutting center, a stone mine, an indoor farm and a house.
That's a good start! You've invited some people from your previous city. They'll arrive in the coming days.\nYour citizens don't seem very happy right now. Let's build a pub to cheer them up a bit.
The pub should make your citizens a bit less sad! To get to the other worlds, you'll need machine parts, so let's create a machine parts factory.
The machine parts factory is very useful, but currently not very efficient. Let's upgrade it to recycle scrap metal. This will reduce the amount of stone it uses.
Upgrade your machine parts factory to make it recycle scrap metal.

[c]You already built some landing pads to connect worlds. Great job![/][n]Good job! Now, it's finally time to get to another world. The easiest way to do that is by building landing pads. Let's build two of them: one on your current world and one on another world you'd like to populate.[/]
Connect the currently populated world with another by building landing pads.

[c]You already built an experimental farm! Well done![/][n]Now that your city has some more space, it'll probably grow rapidly. You'll soon have many more mouths to feed. To make that a bit easier, let's build an experimental farm.[/]

[c]You already built a refined metals factory! Good job![/][n]To build some types of buildings, raw stone isn't good enough. You'll need to refine it first. Let's build a refined metals factory to do just that.[/]

[c]Wow, I'm impressed! You already got the happiness high enough to beat this goal.[/][n]Refined metals are nice, but happy citizens are certainly even nicer. So let's use some of these refined metals to improve the happiness of your citizens. Bring it to at least 80.[/]
Your citizens are really happy now, and they wouldn't want to live anywhere else. Great job!\n\nYou can now play the next scenario, or continue improving your city if you'd like. Thanks for playing!

Humanity is slowly colonizing space. This is the newest outpost. It is still quite small, but new people are arriving quickly.\nYou don't want them to be homeless, of course. To prevent this, build houses until you have at least fifty capacity. It's also a good idea to build some more production buildings and entertainment.
Build houses until you have fifty capacity in total.
(this story event is for compatibility reasons)
Explore the alien ruins on this world.

Well done!
The alien ruins here look different from the ones you saw before. Let's explore them to find out more.

Also, some of the worlds here have a strange glow. Let's build a research craft to investigate this while you're exploring the ruins.
Build a research craft and explore the alien ruins on this world.
Now you've built the spacecraft, it's time to do some research! Make sure a worker is assigned to the research spacecraft and wait until they explored a bit.
Assign a worker to the research spacecraft and wait until they explored a bit.
The worker in the research spacecraft noticed a strange power prevented them from getting close to the glowing worlds. This also means you can't build on them. Maybe the alien ruins can help?
Explore the alien ruins on this world.

While investigating the alien ruins, your explorers found a small device. You think it could have something to do with the inaccessible worlds.\nHowever, none of your citizens has been able to make sense of it. Maybe having some computers would help? To build them, you will first need some refined metals. Build a Refined Metals Factory to produce those.
Your new refined metals factory is looking good!\nBuilding a computer is actually pretty complicated. Therefore, you will need to build the Computing Research Center first.
Great job! Now, you just need some chips to be able to make a computer. Let's build a Computer Chip Factory and make five computer chips.
Build a Computer Chip Factory and make five computer chips.

You built a computer and plugged in the alien device... but there's a bit of a problem. All the data is encrypted!\nMaybe the Hackers of the Bolt can help. However, before they want to settle here, they request you to build three Arcades.
The Hackers of the Bolt seem satisfied with your city. Let's build their HQ now!
Build the Hackers of the Bolt HQ.
The Hackers of the Bolt have taken a look at the encrypted data, but they need some more experience to be able to crack it. Let's complete a few of their missions to help them with that!
Complete a few Hackers of the Bolt missions.
The Hackers of the Bolt think they can now crack the encryption, but they need a specialized computer first. Let's build the Alien Decryptor for them!
Great job! Now the only thing left to do is to wait while the Decryptor does its job. This should take no more than a day.
Let the Decryptor do its job.

The decryption succeeded, and the Hackers of the Bolt will soon be able to remove the restrictive glow from the locked worlds. You can now continue to build an amazing city here! You have also been invited to the City of the Key. Go to the next scenario to accept this invitiation.
Your citizens don't want to destroy buildings right now!
All the people from your previous city have now arrived. Of course, your population can still grow through their offspring.
The people who wanted to move here have now all arrived. Of course, your population can still grow through their offspring.
The Key needs your citizens to be at least moderately happy, otherwise they are slow and useless. You are advised to fix their problems, however ordinary.
A building painted in a single color for decoration purposes, or as a placeholder.
Warning! There are no more rocks on a reachable world! Try building a rock teleporter. If needed, gather some machine chips with the Workshop first.
Warning! You seem to have far more rock teleporters than stone mines. Rock teleporters only teleport rocks. They don't normally produce stone. You need stone mines to actually mine the meteroids.
A nice slanted roof for decoration purposes.
The top of a slanted roof.
Plant young trees which will grow to a branchy forest.
To invite [0] more people to your city, you must have enough houses for them and pay:
You can't find anyone who wants to be invited to your city anymore.
There are not enough houses to invite more people.
You invited [0] people! They'll arrive soon.
A highly rated restaurant with exclusive meals and a stylish atmosphere.
A house for friends of the Secret Society of the Key. As long as The Machine exists, people in this house live forever.
Get Premium to unlock this! I really appreciate your support!
The Secret Society of the Key generously invites you to manage their glorious city.

We, the Secret Society of the Key, hope and expect you are grateful to have arrived in our beautiful city. We want to build a city that proves our greatness, but we are tired of dealing with day-to-day business - we anticipate you can help.

Nowadays, there is a lot of competition between cities. People don't just move to a new colony for free, not even to the glorious City of the Key. They want food as a relocation reward, and who knows what else they'll want in the future. We think this is ridiculous, but it is how it is. Please invite a few more citizens.
Invite some citizens using the Management option.

You can invite new people whenever you desire.\n\nWe feel there may be room for improvement in the production department. We'd like you to produce at least 100 food, 100 stone and 50 knowledge in a day. It may be a good idea to disable our teleporters once in a while, as they seem to require a lot of knowledge.
Produce at least 100 food, 100 stone and 50 knowledge in a day.
The people in this city, rightfully, care about the Glory of the Key. Build five sculpture gardens to improve our Glory, and thus the happiness of our citizens.
[c]We are pleased to see our city has successfully grown to 300 citizens.[/][n]We would like to see our city grow to at least 300 citizens. Maybe you can invite a few people.
Have at least 300 citizens in your city. You can use the invitiation feature.
Our city should gather all the knowledge in the universe. To start, gather at least 150 in a day.
Gather at least 150 knowledge in a day.
It is time for some more glory and luxury. Please build an upscale restaurant for us to improve the Glory of the Key.
Having good transportation is important. [c]We are pleased to see you understand that and have already built some teleporters.[/][n]There should be at least five teleporters in our city.
Have at least five teleporters in your city.
It's good to care for our citizens, but in the end we are obviously the most important. Our house is fine, but it could be better. Research Secretive Living in the Living Research Center.
Research Secretive Living in the Living Research Center.
Now that our house is better, it is time to build some great homes for people we like, too. Build three villas. This increases the Glory of the Key.
The Key should be ever glorious. [c]We are pleased to see that it indeed is.[/][n]Improve the Glory of the Key to 100.
Improve the Glory of the Key to 100. You can check it in the Happiness window.
We have said it before, but we want to stress that knowledge is really important to us. Therefore, gather at least 750 knowledge in a day.
Gather at least 750 knowledge in a day.
Now that we have gathered enough knowledge, it is time to build our secret project. We would like you to build the Machine.
We are quite pleased with your work. Therefore, you can now build a house for the Friends of the Key, who will live forever just like us.

Thank you for playing The Final Earth 2! Partner companies may collect some data about you to improve the game, to handle your purchases and to show ads. I always try to limit this as much as possible.
To help support the game, I ask for your optional consent to show personalized ads. This uses some data about your activity in this game and other apps to show better ads.
This change will apply the next time you start the game.
You can't destroy a floating platform that's supporting buildings.
You can place buildings on this strong platform.
This world is tiny, but it does have some advanced tech.
A dome that can be placed on a roof.
Because of the optimal light conditions, these trees regrow even faster than those in a tree plantation.
Commute Explorer to view citizen travel
Creative mode options for free play
Remove all ads & Boost without an ad
Destroy a building, then leave a hole instead of moving the buildings above downwards.
You can't destroy this building and leave a hole as that would result in an invalid structure.
A bottom piece for two slanted roofs.
Unfortunately, we couldn't save your screenshot. Your city is probably too big to be able to screenshot it.
This bridge doesn't fit here right now.
10+ new buildings, including the Train Station and Aquarium!
Floating Platforms and bridges to build even more creative cities

Your citizens don't have enough food! This makes them very unhappy and they'll work slower. Try building more farms, assigning more workers to farms, or building farms closer to homes to reduce travel time.
Specialized in treating complicated diseases. It improves medical happiness and makes citizens live longer.
Drag to quickly build or replace buildings.
This footbridge connects two buildings at most three spaces apart. Space ships from Landing Pads can travel through it.
This footbridge connects two buildings at most seven spaces apart. Space ships from Landing Pads can travel through it.
A museum for science and technology. It improves art happiness and also educates visitors.
This Christmas tree makes the house feel more welcoming.
A big Christmas tree for the whole city to enjoy.
A festive market with delicious and warming food and drinks.
Build a winter paradise on this snowy world.
Reach at least 60 happiness to unlock.
Welcome to this snowy world! This is a great place to celebrate the holidays. But first, let's build a small base, with at least three houses, two indoor farms, a stone mine and a woodcutting center.
Build three houses, two indoor farms, a stone mine and a woodcutting center.
That's definitively a nice little base, but these houses don't look very festive. Let's add a small Christmas tree to each one to fix this.
Add a Christmas tree to add least three houses.
That's better! A Christmas market can provide your citizens with delicious traditional foods and drinks, such as Lebkuchen and Glhwein. Let's build three of them.
You have some small Christmas trees, but it'd be nice to have a large one as a center for the celebrations. Let's reach 65 happiness first, then build a Christmas tree for the whole city.
Reach 65 happiness, then build a Christmas tree for the whole city.

You've built a great place to celebrate the holidays and your citizens are enjoying themselves very much! If you want to, you can keep playing and improve this city even more.\n\nThank you for playing, I hope you have very happy holidays too, just like your citizens! - Florian
A rooftop apartment with a high ceiling and lots of light, perfect for artists. Generates a small amount of art happiness.
Your citizens consume half as much food. However, their happiness is reduced by a third if it's above 10.
Schools give a 15% better education, but their capacity is reduced by a third.
Your citizens work two hours per day longer. Their happiness goes down gradually while this policy is implemented. After you end it, happiness starts to restore again slowly after a day.
A possibly magical rooftop cafe. Seems to occasionally spawn giant frogs.
A landing pad that can be integrated into a building. It can also be connected to space ship tunnels.
Space ships can pass through this tunnel.
A reinforced bridge that can nicely connect parks or botanical gardens. Can be up to seven spaces wide.
A farm that grows strange purple crops. Produces more food for each adjacent alien house. Not affected by lab technology.
A stylish roof for your botanical gardens.
A rocket can be used to explore space. Rockets can be used only once.
You can't destroy a rocket launch platform while executing a mission.
Your rocket returned safely, but they didn't find anything special during their mission.
Your miners found a fossil! They also gathered [0] stone.
Your miners found some shiny crystals that can be used as [0] refined metals.
The factory will use wood to make rocket fuel.
The factory will use food to make rocket fuel.
[0] food/wood used to make [1] rocket fuel.
Makes rocket fuel from wood or food. One resource is used to make one unit of rocket fuel.
A window for decorative purposes, or as a placeholder.
You need to pick four crew members to start a mission!
We couldn't find the right workers for this crew, or they couldn't reach the rocket!
Your biologists found a blueprint to build an alien farm, along with some strange seeds that you might be able to grow there.
Your explorers found a planet with a strange hat-shaped building. It feels a bit magical. You can now build it.
Your engineers thought of a way to make rocket fuel more efficiently, which you can now research at rocket fuel factories.
Your explorers discovered a planet fully covered by oceans. They saw underwater houses, and discovered how to build them.
Makes citizens who visit it live longer.
Your biologists found a tree that looks really old. They think it's likely the oldest tree in the universe.
Rocket fuel is produced faster and uses half the resources.
The factory works faster and uses one less stone per unit of refined metal produced.
You found a world covered with machines, where your engineers discovered a way to improve refined metal factories.
Note: Achievements are disabled in saves that have ever used unlimited resources.
Open the Workshop to get mods
Mods are automatically activated. You can deactivate them here.
Open the Workshop to customize your mod page and change other settings

Create a directory in <tt>%localappdata%\the-final-earth-2\User Data\Default\mods</tt> to develop your mod. Then, choose the directory below, change other info if desired and click Upload to upload your mod.
No mods found - click to refresh
Trains can go extra fast here.
Build ten train stations to unlock!
This shows the capacity of your entertainment per type.
You explored a lush planet. Your explorers took some plants and creatures with them, so you can now build the Otherworldly Zoo.
You can now prepare a mission.
Lower fuel cost and shorter journey time.\n[0]% explored
Potential for more exotic findings, but takes longer and a higher fuel cost.\n[0]% explored
A zoo with otherworldly plants and animals.
Your engineers studied a world that was covered with a layer of graphene. With some further research, they could make graphene factories work faster.
You saw a world that was a giant abandoned supercomputer. Your engineers took some of its technology to make your own supercomputer produce more knowledge.
Your mission successfully returned, but unfortunately you found nothing special.
You landed on a world that turned out to be a maze of teleporters. After finally making it out, your engineers managed to make your own teleporters run more efficiently.
You can't find the creature anymore.
People love dancing with an alien atmosphere.
On a jungle world, you found some bacteria that produce fuel from waste. Your biologists used this knowledge to make your rocket fuel factories work faster.
Four crew members fit in the rocket. You can choose workers from certain buildings. Choose them wisely to affect what you can find.
Reduce fuel cost and journey time
Your explorers found a rocket wreck. They investigated it and found a way to build rockets using fewer materials.
A crew of four explorers will accompany the ship on this mission. It will use [0] rocket fuel.
What do you want to send?
You don't have enough materials for that.
We couldn't find enough citizens to send to the other city!
You can now switch to your explored city! After you've visited it once, you can send resources and citizens with the rocket.
Your explorers found a rocky new world. It seems a bit barren, but it also looks habitable. You can now colonize it.
Your explorers found a group of habitable wooded worlds you can now colonize.
Plant young trees which will grow to a red forest.
Plant young trees which will grow to a otherworldly purple forest.
Your explorers found an abandoned nightclub. The lights were still working. They took some parts of it, and documented it carefully, so you can now rebuild it.
A large, luxurious house with a private teleporter. It improves education of residents, and makes them live slightly longer. The housing quality is increased by 25 if connected to another mansion.
Green roofs can look really nice and give your citizens more space to experience nature.
The Feather Alliance has one simple goal: discover everything they can about the universe. They'd appreciate your help.
Texture and concept by Luk XD 99
You can make this redwood grow in [0] hours.
You can make this redwood grow in one hour.
A tree that can grow really tall. It can only be built on the ground. You can make it grow once every 24 hours.
Build a tree house here. It can house two people.
Make this redwood grow taller. You can do this once every 24 hours.
You cannot destroy this redwood tree, as that would result a tree house to be placed in an incorrect location.

The Machine produces 50% more materials and it sometimes also produces graphene and rocket fuel. If it's ever destroyed, Secret Society of the Key members stay alive longer. Members of the Feather Alliance live longer.
Gather the birds: Make sure all 7 jobs are filled.
Make the Future Fast:\nProduce at least 100 graphene in a day.
Explore the Neighborhood:\nUse rockets to explore nearby space completely.
Returning Home Should Be Pleasant:\nBuild ten rooftop parks.
Look Beyond the End of Your Nose:\nExplore distant space completely.
Our Own Adventure:\nSend out a rocket on the Feather Alliance Trip.
Now We Need Some Rest:\nBuild two mansions.
Bring Our Knowledge Together:\nBuild the Intergalactic Library.
The Feather Alliance would like to go on a long trip to explore the universe.
The Feather Alliance have successfully completed their trip! They have, among other discoveries, found a new colonizable group of worlds.
This grand library greatly educates visitors. Workers produce knowledge based on the total number of citizens in associated cities. Also allows you to research city upgrades.

Allows you to build the following unique buildings a second time: Workshop, Experimental Farm, Observatory, Art Colony, Computing Research Center, Living Research Center, Lab Escape Room, and Supercomputer. Their city upgrades are still available only once.
The production of The Machine is increased by 50% for each Machine in an associated city.
Allows you to plant the purple and red forests and grass from Wooded Worlds, and the blue flowers from Bridge Worlds.
This wooden footbridge connects two buildings at most three spaces apart. Space ships from Landing Pads can travel through it.
There seems to be a lot of space to explore, so you set out to build a rocket.

There's a lot of space left to explore. Building a rocket would make that a lot easier. This gray stone world looks like the perfect spot to use as a launch site.\n\nThere's already a small colony here, but you'll want to expand it. You can invite extra citizens as desired. Also, let's make these people a bit happier. Increase their happiness to at 75.

Your citizens feel much happier now! [c]You've already built some bridges, great![/][n]It'd be useful if people could walk more easily between towers or even worlds. Build three bridges to make that happen.[/]
Building and navigating a rocket would be really hard without computers. Therefore, you'll need some computer chips. Let's build a computing research center and then a computer chip factory.
Build a computing research center and then a computer chip factory.
Just a few computer chips won't be enough. You'll need a steady supply. Let's produce at least 30 a day.
Produce at least 30 computer chips in a day.

Making a rocket isn't an easy task, so you'll need a lot of knowledge. A supercomputer can help gather knowledge, so let's build one. It's not cheap though, so ensure you invite enough citizens, and that they have good transportation so they don't spend too much time traveling to work.

Now you're gathering knowledge quickly, it's time to look into a new material. Graphene is an incredibly thin and light, yet strong, material. That makes it a great material to use in building a rocket. You'll need to experiment a bit before you can use the material properly, though. Let's build a graphene lab to do that and start making your first sheets of graphene.
Graphene has more uses than just building rockets. For example, floating platforms can be used to expand your city or bridge gaps. Let's build one.
The graphene lab is a fine way to make graphene, but it is rather slow. The graphene factory uses knowledge to operate, but it works much quicker. Let's build one.
You'll need a place to launch your rocket from, so let's build a rocket launch platform.
The rocket will need fuel, or it'll just stay on the ground. You can use food or wood to make biofuel. Build at least three rocket fuel factories to start producing some.
Now that your rocket fuel is steadily being produced, you can actually build your first rocket!
Now, it's finally time to launch! Launch a rocket to nearby space with some explorers in it.
Launch a rocket to nearby space with at least one explorer in it.

Your rocket mission was successful, and you found another world to build on! Great job! You can now continue building an intergalactic society across multiple cities. You can also launch more rocket missions to discover even more!
